intro: Inula gutierrezii, commonly known as the Mexican elecampane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces a distinctive, aromatic scent. Inula gutierrezii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
